sentences.sContent: Mr. Thomas was suffering from depression.
sentences.sCn: 托马斯先生当时正受抑郁症折磨。

sentences.sContent: ...Then there is the finding we cited in our Science paper of higher divorce and depression rates among a large group of British men who attended single-sex schools as teenagers...
...What distinguishes a depression from a harsh recession is paralyzing fear - fear of the unknown so great that it causes consumers...
...That these huge declines didn't lead to depression mainly reflects...
...Why didn't the current recession turn into a depression according to Christina Romer...

synos.tran: 沮丧；[地理]洼地；[经]不景气；忧愁

phrases.pCn: 大萧条（美国经济大萧条时期）

words.tran: 使沮丧；使萧条（depress的过去式和过去分词形式）；压低

trans.tranCn: 抑郁， 沮丧； 不景气， 萧条； 洼地， 凹陷
trans.tranOther: the period during the 1930s when there was not much business activity and not many jobs
